Japanese: アンマリー＿喜んで話す

みて！　私の人形たち！
今朝、届いた。
English:
Look! Those are my mechs!
They arrived this morning.

Japanese:
これ、円工房のヴィンテージだ。
ずいぶん旧式だけど、手入れは
行き届いてる。
English: This one is a vintage piece from the Circle Workshop. Pretty old-fashioned, but looks like it's been well looked after.

Japanese:
あら？
なかなか見る目あるじゃん。
English:
Oh?
You've got a good eye there.

Japanese:
あんた、今風のものしか知らな
いみたいだから、伝統の良さは
理解不能かと思ったけど。
English: You only seem to care about modern mechs, so I doubted that you'd be able to appreciate the value of something so traditional.

Japanese:
ま、古い物も、少しは
わかるみたいね。
English: Well, I guess you know a little bit about the older models after all.

Japanese: アンマリー＿親しい人と話す

じゃあ、約束どおり、
人形遊びね。
ケイ＿むしゃくしゃするＬ

人形使い同士が、腕を競う
ために考え出された伝統的
なゲームよ！
English: It's a traditional game played between puppeteers to determine who's the most skilled!

Japanese: アンマリー＿親しい人と話す

制限時間内に、ポールを
たくさん壊した方の勝ち。
簡単でしょ。
English: Whoever breaks the most poles within the time limit, wins. It's simple.

Japanese: 妨害、攻撃、なんでもアリ。
English: You can obstruct, attack, anything goes.

Japanese: アンマリー＿挑発する等

どう？
怖くなければ
勝負を受けなさいよ。
English:
How about it?
Come on and face me, if you're not too scared, that is.

Japanese:
おう！　やってやる。
なあ、/p！
アンマリー＿親しい人と話す

じゃあ、いくよ。
軽くひねっちゃおうかな。
English:
Then, let's go.
Try put up at least a bit of a fight.
(I'm a daughter of the Dancourt family.)

Japanese:
（人形使いになるために
　生まれてきた）
English: (I was born to be a puppeteer.)

Japanese: アンマリー＿操縦険しい

（絶対に……
　あんたたちには負けない）
English:
(Make no mistake...
I'd never lose to the likes of them.)
